info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns an ApplicationGateway resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates the specified application gateway.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update application gateway operation.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ApplicationGateway resource.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ApplicationGateway resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

204.description: Request successful. Resource with the specified name does not exist.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates the specified application gateway tags.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

requestBody.description: Parameters supplied to update application gateway tags.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ApplicationGateway resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all application gateways in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of ApplicationGateway resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all the application gateways in a subscription.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of ApplicationGateway resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

200.description: Request successful. The operation starts the ApplicationGateway resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Stops the specified application gateway in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

200.description: Request successful. The operation stops the ApplicationGateway resource.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the backend health of the specified application gateway in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expands BackendAddressPool and BackendHttpSettings referenced in backend health.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the backend health for given combination of backend pool and http setting of the specified application gateway in a resource group.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: applicationGatewayName
parameters.description: The name of the application gateway.

parameters.name: $expand
parameters.description: Expands BackendAddressPool and BackendHttpSettings referenced in backend health.

requestBody.description: Request body for on-demand test probe operation.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of all available server variables.
Success. The operation returns a list of all available request headers.
Success. The operation returns a list of all available response headers.

get.description: Lists all available web application firewall rule sets.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a list of all available web application firewall rule sets.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists available Ssl options for configuring Ssl policy.

200.description: Success. The operation returns all available Ssl options for configuring Ssl policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Lists all SSL predefined policies for configuring Ssl policy.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a lists of all Ssl predefined policies for configuring Ssl policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets Ssl predefined policy with the specified policy name.

parameters.name: predefinedPolicyName
parameters.description: Name of Ssl predefined policy.

200.description: Success. The operation returns a Ssl predefined policy with the specified policy name.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

protocol.description: The protocol used for the probe.

host.description: Host name to send the probe to.

path.description: Relative path of probe. Valid path starts from '/'. Probe is sent to <Protocol>://<host>:<port><path>.

timeout.description: The probe timeout in seconds. Probe marked as failed if valid response is not received with this timeout period. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

pickHostNameFromBackendHttpSettings.description: Whether the host header should be picked from the backend http settings. Default value is false.

match.description: Criterion for classifying a healthy probe response.

backendAddressPool.description: Reference to backend pool of application gateway to which probe request will be sent.

backendHttpSettings.description: Reference to backend http setting of application gateway to be used for test probe.

ApplicationGatewayOnDemandProbe.description: Details of on demand test probe request.

ApplicationGatewayBackendHealthOnDemand.description: Result of on demand test probe.

ApplicationGatewayBackendHealth.description: Response for ApplicationGatewayBackendHealth API service call.

address.description: IP address or FQDN of backend server.

ipConfiguration.description: Reference to IP configuration of backend server.

name.description: Name of an application gateway SKU.

capacity.description: Capacity (instance count) of an application gateway.

disabledSslProtocols.description: Ssl protocols to be disabled on application gateway.

cipherSuites.description: Ssl cipher suites to be enabled in the specified order to application gateway.

minProtocolVersion.description: Minimum version of Ssl protocol to be supported on application gateway.

subnet.description: Reference to the subnet resource. A subnet from where application gateway gets its private address.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the application gateway IP configuration resource.

name.description: Name of the IP configuration that is unique within an Application Gateway.

requireServerNameIndication.description: Applicable only if protocol is https. Enables SNI for multi-hosting.

hostNames.description: List of Host names for HTTP Listener that allows special wildcard characters as well.

redirectConfiguration.description: Redirect configuration resource of URL path map path rule.

rewriteRuleSet.description: Rewrite rule set resource of URL path map path rule.

ApplicationGatewayPathRule.description: Path rule of URL path map of an application gateway.

protocol.description: The protocol used for the probe.

host.description: Host name to send the probe to.

path.description: Relative path of probe. Valid path starts from '/'. Probe is sent to <Protocol>://<host>:<port><path>.

interval.description: The probing interval in seconds. This is the time interval between two consecutive probes. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

timeout.description: The probe timeout in seconds. Probe marked as failed if valid response is not received with this timeout period. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 86400 seconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: The probe retry count. Backend server is marked down after consecutive probe failure count reaches UnhealthyThreshold. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 20.

pickHostNameFromBackendHttpSettings.description: Whether the host header should be picked from the backend http settings. Default value is false.

minServers.description: Minimum number of servers that are always marked healthy. Default value is 0.

match.description: Criterion for classifying a healthy probe response.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the probe resource.

port.description: Custom port which will be used for probing the backend servers. The valid value ranges from 1 to 65535. In case not set, port from http settings will be used. This property is valid for Standard_v2 and WAF_v2 only.

ApplicationGatewayProbePropertiesFormat.description: Properties of probe of an application gateway.

body.description: Body that must be contained in the health response. Default value is empty.

statusCodes.description: Allowed ranges of healthy status codes. Default range of healthy status codes is 200-399.

ApplicationGatewayProbeHealthResponseMat.description: Application gateway probe health response match.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway probe.

name.description: Name of the probe that is unique within an Application Gateway.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

priority.description: Priority of the request routing rule.

backendHttpSettings.description: Backend http settings resource of the application gateway.

rewriteRuleSet.description: Rewrite Rule Set resource in Basic rule of the application gateway.

redirectConfiguration.description: Redirect configuration resource of the application gateway.

properties.description: Properties of the application gateway request routing rule.

name.description: Name of the request routing rule that is unique within an Application Gateway.

name.description: Name of the rewrite rule set that is unique within an Application Gateway.

etag.description: A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.

ApplicationGatewayRewriteRuleSet.description: Rewrite rule set of an application gateway.

rewriteRules.description: Rewrite rules in the rewrite rule set.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the rewrite rule set resource.

ApplicationGatewayRewriteRuleSetProperti.description: Properties of rewrite rule set of the application gateway.

name.description: Name of the rewrite rule that is unique within an Application Gateway.

ruleSequence.description: Rule Sequence of the rewrite rule that determines the order of execution of a particular rule in a RewriteRuleSet.

conditions.description: Conditions based on which the action set execution will be evaluated.

actionSet.description: Set of actions to be done as part of the rewrite Rule.

ApplicationGatewayRewriteRule.description: Rewrite rule of an application gateway.

variable.description: The condition parameter of the RewriteRuleCondition.

pattern.description: The pattern, either fixed string or regular expression, that evaluates the truthfulness of the condition.

ignoreCase.description: Setting this paramter to truth value with force the pattern to do a case in-sensitive comparison.

negate.description: Setting this value as truth will force to check the negation of the condition given by the user.

ApplicationGatewayRewriteRuleCondition.description: Set of conditions in the Rewrite Rule in Application Gateway.

requestHeaderConfigurations.description: Request Header Actions in the Action Set.

responseHeaderConfigurations.description: Response Header Actions in the Action Set.

urlConfiguration.description: Url Configuration Action in the Action Set.

ApplicationGatewayRewriteRuleActionSet.description: Set of actions in the Rewrite Rule in Application Gateway.

headerName.description: Header name of the header configuration.

headerValue.description: Header value of the header configuration.

ApplicationGatewayHeaderConfiguration.description: Header configuration of the Actions set in Application Gateway.

modifiedPath.description: Url path which user has provided for url rewrite. Null means no path will be updated. Default value is null.

modifiedQueryString.description: Query string which user has provided for url rewrite. Null means no query string will be updated. Default value is null.

reroute.description: If set as true, it will re-evaluate the url path map provided in path based request routing rules using modified path. Default value is false.

ApplicationGatewayUrlConfiguration.description: Url configuration of the Actions set in Application Gateway.

targetListener.description: Reference to a listener to redirect the request to.

targetUrl.description: Url to redirect the request to.

includePath.description: Include path in the redirected url.

includeQueryString.description: Include query string in the redirected url.

urlPathMaps.description: Url path maps specifying default redirect configuration.

gatewayIPConfigurations.description: Subnets of the application gateway resource. For default limits, see [Application Gateway limits](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-subscription-service-limits#application-gateway-limits).

enableHttp2.description: Whether HTTP2 is enabled on the application gateway resource.

enableFips.description: Whether FIPS is enabled on the application gateway resource.

resourceGuid.description: The resource GUID property of the application gateway resource.

provisioningState.description: The provisioning state of the application gateway resource.

customErrorConfigurations.description: Custom error configurations of the application gateway resource.

forceFirewallPolicyAssociation.description: If true, associates a firewall policy with an application gateway regardless whether the policy differs from the WAF Config.

zones.description: A list of availability zones denoting where the resource needs to come from.

identity.description: The identity of the application gateway, if configured.

enabled.description: Whether the web application firewall is enabled or not.

ruleSetType.description: The type of the web application firewall rule set. Possible values are: 'OWASP'.

ruleSetVersion.description: The version of the rule set type.

requestBodyCheck.description: Whether allow WAF to check request Body.

maxRequestBodySize.description: Maximum request body size for WAF.

fileUploadLimitInMb.description: Maximum file upload size in Mb for WAF.

ApplicationGatewayWebApplicationFirewall.description: Application gateway web application firewall configuration.

minCapacity.description: Lower bound on number of Application Gateway capacity.

maxCapacity.description: Upper bound on number of Application Gateway capacity.

enabled.description: Whether connection draining is enabled or not.

drainTimeoutInSec.description: The number of seconds connection draining is active. Acceptable values are from 1 second to 3600 seconds.

ApplicationGatewayConnectionDraining.description: Connection draining allows open connections to a backend server to be active for a specified time after the backend server got removed from the configuration.

ruleGroupName.description: The name of the rule group that will be disabled.

rules.description: The list of rules that will be disabled. If null, all rules of the rule group will be disabled.

ApplicationGatewayFirewallDisabledRuleGr.description: Allows to disable rules within a rule group or an entire rule group.

ApplicationGatewayAvailableRequestHeader.description: Response for ApplicationGatewayAvailableRequestHeaders API service call.

selectorMatchOperator.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operate on the selector to specify which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

selector.description: When matchVariable is a collection, operator used to specify which elements in the collection this exclusion applies to.

ApplicationGatewayFirewallExclusion.description: Allow to exclude some variable satisfy the condition for the WAF check.

value.description: The list of application gateway rule sets.
